newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Creative Tech rises.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Creative Tech rises.

text.p: Singapore software company Creative Technology Ltd rose Friday to highlight trade in American Depositary Receipts (ADRs).
Traders said the ADR market was largely following the rest of Wall Street higher.
"Generally the (foreign) markets have been fairly stable. As far as I can see there are not any real features," a trader said.
Creative Technology rose 3/4 to 19-3/4 on heavy volume. Its ADR was the most active on New York markets.
The jump came after Creative said it had obtained a preliminary court order against Cyrix Corp and some customers of Cyrix's Media GX chip.
Creative has sued Cyrix for false advertising, trademark and copyright infringement and unfair competition.
Luxury goods maker Gucci Group rose 1-7/8 to 65-5/8 on heavy volume. The ADR had dropped 3-1/8 on Thursday after Robertson Stephens downgraded the ADR to long-term attractive to buy.
"We think it's just a bit of a bounce. It (Gucci) probably went a bit too far yesterday," a trader said.

Brazilian telephone company Telebras SA rose 1-7/8 to 125-1/2 and was among the most active ADRs. Traders said the share had been boosted by optimism over progress of Brazil's new telecommunications law in Congress and on higher rates.
Chilean supermarket chain Supermercados Unimarc SA debuted on the New York Stock Exchange. It jumped 1-3/8 in mid-morning trade to 18.
Advancers led decliners 269 to 156 among 806 ADRs. The ADR group rose 0.38 percent and volume was 29 million shares.
